column4: I need to run a windows software (no, it doesn't work with wine), but I would like to have Ubutu as my main os because I don't trust Windows. Is there a way to have a clean environment to do this?
a virtual machine could work
that is what I am doing right now...
what are you having trouble with?
it is very slow in the VM
what are the specs (cpu & ram) of the computer?
i7 with 8gb of ram
unless you are running a flight simulator, virtualbox shouldn't be runnig slowly on that much hardware!
what application is it you are trying to use? Also, is it just the application that is slow, or windows itself in the virtual machine?
windows itslef is slow
the interface lags
what version of windows are you running and how much ram did you allocate to the virtual machine?
win 7 ultimate with 4GB of ram
run the windows 7 performance tool and post a screenshot of the results (should look like http://www.chotocheeta.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/11/win7_q6600_650_sli_8400_02.jpg )
windows can not do the performance test in the vm
check in the virtualbox settings to see if hardware acceleration is enabled, if your computer doesn't support it, you will have to turn off Aero in windows
it is turned on. and my cpu does support virtualization
the only other thing I can recommend is turning off the win7 special effects. anything beyond that and you'll have to ask the guys in #windows
you could also dual-boot if that works better for you
I am considering that..
thanks for the help. I think I will replace Ubuntu with Windows with virus scanner and encryption.
just out of curiosity, what application is it that you need windows for (we are always curious as to what apps linux is lacking)
it is chat client for trading..
ah, never worked with those. I know lots of trading *servers* run linux, but not sure about clients.
